alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Quitman; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 7:33AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and North Mississippi, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Lee and Phillips. In North Mississippi, Coahoma, Quitman and Tunica. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marianna, Marvell, Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, Marks, Lambert, Jonestown, Friars Point, Tunica, Sledge, Lexa, Moro, Rondo, Aubrey, Haynes, Dundee, Dubbs, Kings, North Tunica and Belen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
